titleStmt.title: William W. Herndon et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9961

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency B MaGoffin
Governor of Kentucky
The undersigned Citizens of McCracken County,

Respectfully, State that at the Jany term of the McCracken Equity & Criminal Court 1860, Wm Mullins was fined for disturbing religious worship and at the Same term he was fined for a Breach of the Peace, D. C. Wilcox replevied Said fines, the amount of the first is $62.35 & the last $37.71. Mullins has no property, and Wilcox will have to pay the fines unless your Excellency will release him from the Same which Your petitioners respectfully ask as it would be hard and unjust for Wilcox to pay. Said fines --

Names --
Wm W. Herndon
John Keebler
Scott Saurir
Joel Johns
T. J. Lovelace
Jno Farrar
W F Norton
R S Ratcliffe
G F McClelland
A. B. Kinkead
R O Woodfolk
G T Dabb
J. Y. Quigley
Geo, A, Allen
John Q. A. King
